item.title: What's the sand texture used in most maps?
item.author: invalid@example.com (Carbohydrates)
item.dc:creator: Carbohydrates
item.content:encoded: I just can't find the name of the cracked sand tex used for the ground of PerilPlateau, DeathValley and such.

item.title: gotta haves in next map
item.author: invalid@example.com (kanonfodder)
item.dc:creator: kanonfodder
item.content:encoded: Just came to me. Next maps have to have the loop-to-loop and/or the spiral upside down and back down thingy. Don't know if the physics are up to it or that a barracude with nitros could handle either one, but would be fun

item.title: Easily create CB maps?
item.author: invalid@example.com (double9s)
item.dc:creator: double9s
item.content:encoded:
So I was looking through the map tutorial (because CB is fantastic and if no one else will build maps for me, I might just try it myself) and I have what might be a stupid question. Ok, the last time i used UnrealED was back in Unreal 1 and that was just playin around so I don't have a good knowledge base. But from what i picked up from the CB tutorial it seems like you just need things like a clone jar holder and pumps and stuff like that specific to CB. My question is, couldn't you open...

Easily create CB maps?

item.title: using deathvalley
item.author: invalid@example.com (Screech)
item.dc:creator: Screech
item.content:encoded:
Hello demiurge,

I hope you don't mind if I use deathvalley as a base of sorta from which I am going to make another map. I will flatten out most of the terrain before starting, as all I really want to preserve is the texturing, the outer edge of cliffs and the skybox. I know this is a bit late to ask for permission because I started on this hours ago (lol ) but anyway I figured I had to ask.

oh, and thanks for the mail

item.title: [New map] CLN-IslandHop
item.author: invalid@example.com (-BaSToS-)
item.dc:creator: -BaSToS-
item.content:encoded:
Hi,

I'm new to UT2004 maping & I just started converting ONS-IslandHop (from editor's choice bonus pack) to Clone Bandits.

This is my first map convertion so don't be too cruel.

editor's choice bonus pack is needed for textures & meshes files (you can download it from GamersHell for example)

here is the link : http://xbastosx.free.fr/ut2004/CLN-IslandHop_beta1.rar

have fun & give me feedback on how to enhance this map.

PS : high jumping from the moscowboy into...

[New map] CLN-IslandHop

item.title: idea for other (next?)map
item.author: invalid@example.com (Screech)
item.dc:creator: Screech
item.content:encoded:
I've been playing clone bandits online a lot--i'm a regular at a few of the servers. needless to say, although the mod kicks ass, the one map gets repetitive. however, i think it would take away a bit of the fun to have a totally different map because a lot of what makes this game so cool is the future-retro look of not only the vhicles but also the map itself. so, i figure: why not make a "darknight" version of this map? the only thing that i think would need to be changed with the mod...

idea for other (next?)map

item.title: characters on the third ut2003 disk
item.author: invalid@example.com (o0Dekker0o)
item.dc:creator: o0Dekker0o
item.content:encoded:
I just noticed that there is a folder on the 3rd ut2003 disk with all the characters in there...

asp.upp
gorge.upp

etc


does anyone know what program opens them ?

The meshes folder has a few files also and can open them in milkshape

item.title: importing the great tank into 3dsmax
item.author: invalid@example.com (o0Dekker0o)
item.dc:creator: o0Dekker0o
item.content:encoded:
i'd like a to take a better look at that great tank in 3dsmax without textures. How and what tools do i use


Also does anyone know how to export the Aida.gem character file from Unreal2 into a 3ds file ?

Unreal 2 comes with a golem model viewer but with now export function

anyone help

item.title: Level Design Tutorial
item.author: invalid@example.com (hottoast)
item.dc:creator: hottoast
item.content:encoded:
Hey folks,

We've recently created a doc for all of you burgeoning level designers out there. This will help if you'd like to try your hand at creating maps for Clone Bandits. We've even got the tutorial in two distinct flavors, PDF and RTF. Take a look, and let us know if you're making the Next Great Map for our collective...

Level Design Tutorial
